metadata.Title: CVE-2016-0705 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
Double free vulnerability in the dsa_priv_decode function in crypto/dsa/dsa_ameth.c in OpenSSL 1.0.1 before 1.0.1s and 1.0.2 before 1.0.2g allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (memory corruption) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a malformed DSA private key.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-0705` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libssl1.0.0 - 1.0.2g-1ubuntu2
openssl - 1.0.2g-1ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openssl package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.0.2g-1ubuntu2').
